response.answer_text: books quantity doesn't matter, quality is. if you are naive in cgl preparation, first you have to solve at least 5–6 previous years papers to check your subject wise score. the following are the best books for the preparation of CGL: ENGLISH: a single book & resource is not sufficed for your preparation, English is divided into 3 major sections: (a) vocab (b) grammar (c) comprehension.vocab: (a) sp Bakshi: read repeat, do this process umpteen times. this book provides vocab ie. OWS, IDIOMS, PHRASAL VERB, PREPOSITIONS, WORD MEANING, provided in a lucid manner. gave special emphasis on preposition chart and a phrasal verb.learn religiously previous year antonyms, synonyms, one-word substitution, idiom and phrases compiled in qmaths websites. believe me or not it is highly beneficial.(b) grammar: read plinth to paramount 4–5 times, that's more than enough. solve practise sets given in a mirror of common errors.(c) comprehension: the more your reading, the better the marks will be. so ultimate mantra is to read & apprehend any source ie. newspaper or novel on the daily basis. mostly people lack here, they neglect this section and become in the rat race of learning grammar. understanding sentence structure cannot solely understand by grammar rules, it is your reading aptitude which gives u a better edge over others. vocab, PQRS, CLOSE TEST, COMPREHENSION can be solved easily by this. give time to this…. pleaseQUANT: (a) Rakesh Yadav class notes (b) Kiran chapter wise previous years paper (c) lucent higher mathematics part-2 or sarvesh Kumar quantum cat, do level 1 & 2 only.GS: (a) previous year papers (b) if you have time then read science, geography, history from NCERT, otherwise, take any source ie. any coaching notes or Adda capsule etc. now current affairs questions also played a major role, hence you should buy a monthly magazine or download current affairs capsule from Adda 247 or testbook website. the arrival of TCS as a vendor may surprise you in the current affairs section, so you must be ready for in-depth current affairs.REASONING: no such book is required for this section, only previous years papers & mocks are more than enough. topics like series, figure counting, statement & assumption demand special attention which you can seek from youtube.don't neglect previous year papers, solve it umpteen time. and track your weakness and progress through mocks. and lastly always remember revision is the key, do a book umpteen time.addition to this, some of the important fundas you should be aware of in preparing of SSC CGL:Concept clarity is sufficient and recommended as per as new types of questions were introduced in cgl mains 2017, so it is highly recommended that you must do preparation with new pattern… I listed some of the dos and donts:1.if you are lacking in concept building then it is high time you started your preparation with NCERT (class 8–10).don't cram just understand the topic and maxim given in the book. No book or tutor can teach you better than NCERTs. 2.when you find you grasp the concept, move on some exercise given in NCERTs or R.D. SHARMA book. 3.try to solve previous year sets of maths (not topics) and figure out what is the core area where you lack the most. 4.if time persist kindly solve the level 1& 2 exercises given in QUANTUM CAT by Sarvesh Verma. 5.take a good mock series like KD OR SSCTUBE, and take it in every weak whether you able to solve fully or not.just sit and try to maximise your score every weak. 6.don't be panic and persistent in note making, solving quizzes, diverse questions daily. (DON'T SKIP THIS). For English you have to figure out what is the major concern you are facing?? are you not find English interesting or poor in vocab or not able to solve the reading section? well now I give the answer one by one in stepwise below: 1.era of repeated questions is somehow ended so it's time to change your strategy, for vocab just read any newspaper (I prefer THE HINDU), read any 2–3 article which you find interesting in reading, an editorial section is not must. English is a language so first you have to develop a passion for reading and apprehend it in the right manner. 2.just watch any Hindu editorial vocab session in YouTube and JOT down, you may take the screenshot as well. 3.make a daily habit of solving mini mocks of various topics. 4.don't cram one-word substitution and idiom and phrases, just see it daily and it is more than enough. 5.put special effort on reading comprehension and close test(55 marks), error section with sentence improvement(40–45 marks). 6.don't ignore the importance of phrasal verb and vocab which is asked in every section of English. 7.take English as a way of your daily life, you never find English boring. 8.don't cram grammar rules, just solve enormous and diverse questions of error and then see the rule where it is applied. 9.mocks are the real analysis of your preparation, so pick any good test series like textbook or KD or ssctube and give it on a weakly basis and try to maximise your score

Best Book for SSC CGL As there are many SSC CGL2019 exam is approaching, the first and foremost important question strikes in mind of an serious aspirants which books and study materials one should prefer in preparation, being a serious candidates of this exam, here by I want to present my own books which I am going to follow along with Mock tests. Before that it is also neccessary to get familiar with the syllabus of this exam. Syllabus of SSC CGL:- SSC CGL Tier 1 and Tier 2 exams are completely based on Computer based test (CBT) i.e. online, consists of different subjects. Tier-1: 4 Section will be there GS, English, Maths (Quant) and reasoning. each section will have 25 questions each of 50 marks, so total 100 questions of 200 marks. Tier-2: 2 Sections will be consists of Maths and English consisting 100 questions for Maths and 200 questions of English, total 400 marks On the other hand, Tier 3 is a descriptive paper that is supposed to be answered in Hindi or English language. Best English book for SSC CGL:- Plinth to Paramount by Neetu Singh :- if you are looking for clarification of various grammar rules and their applications in the actual context. This book is necessary for Tier II English in SSC CGL and the mains exam in other cases.  Objective General English by S.P. Bakshi: Objective General English has been divided into four main sections. Section A is a Foundation Module that apprises one about the essential syntax of the language, section B is for improving the verbal ability and the last two sections deal with Practical Grammar and its applications under different conditions.  One can also go with ‘Mirrors of Common Errors’, I personally found this book interesting and should be read after reading any of one Book.  Quant (Maths) “How to Prepare for Verbal Ability and Reading Comprehension – By Arun Sharma”  This book is really good for beginners as it contains three level questions in each Chapter i.e. Level-1, Level-2, Level-3 according to the difficulty.  “7300_ by Rakesh Yadav is also one of the best books for Quant preperation. SSC CGL Best Books For General Awareness Lucent's General Knowledge  “previous year papers of GS along with this book will be more than sufficient for static portion and for Current one should follow any magzine like GK-today or any other.” In the above book one can find History, geography, economy, science and Indian politics covered well and upto mark.Revise the book again and again atleast 5 6 times from end to end.I would not ask any body to makes notes out of newspaper instead I would say make notes out of Monthly magazine like GK- today or any other, this will definately suffice. BAKSHI“151 Essays” by S.C Gupta“Handbook for letter writing” by S.C.
